    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Giant Wasp</h1>Giant wasps are much more dangerous but less common than their smaller kin, and—to the relief of those who encounter them—they tend to be solitary.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Animal</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10">Nature</a></u>)</b>: DC 18<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=405">Giant Wasp</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 3</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Wasp_GiantWasp.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Wasp_GiantWasp.png"></a><span alt="Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral">N</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Animal Trait" class="trait" title="An animal is a creature with a relatively low intelligence. It typically doesn’t have an Intelligence ability modifier over –4, can’t speak languages, and can’t be trained in Intelligence-based skills."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=9">Animal</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 324</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +8; darkvision<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +11, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +9<br /><b>Str</b> +4, <b>Dex</b> +4, <b>Con</b> +4, <b>Int</b> -5, <b>Wis</b> +1, <b>Cha</b> +1<hr /><b>AC</b> 19, <b>Fort</b> +9, <b>Ref</b> +11, <b>Will</b> +6<br /><b>HP</b> 45<hr /><b>Speed</b> 20 feet, fly 40 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> stinger +12 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126"><u>poison</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d12+4 piercing plus giant wasp venom</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Giant Wasp Venom</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=93"><u>incapacitation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126"><u>poison</a></u>) <b>Saving Throw</b> Fortitude DC 19; <b>Maximum Duration</b> 6 rounds; <b>Stage 1</b> no effect (1 round); <b>Stage 2</b> clumsy 2 (1 round); <b>Stage 3</b> paralyzed (1 round)</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Implant Eggs</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  The giant wasp lays eggs in an adjacent creature that is paralyzed or unconscious, exposing it to the wasp larva disease.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Wasp Larva</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=46"><u>disease</a></u>) <b>Saving Throw</b> Fortitude DC 21; <b>Stage 1</b> carrier with no ill effect (1d6 days); <b>Stage 2</b> drained 1 (1d3 days); <b>Stage 3</b> 5d6 damage, larva emerges (disease ends)</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=99">Wasp</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=405">Giant Wasp</a></td><td>3</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=406">Wasp Swarm</a></td><td>4</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=99">Wasp</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 324</i></a><br />While the common wasp poses little threat to a hardy adventurer aside from an uncomfortable sting, a large and aggressive swarm of these territorial insects—to say nothing of their oversized kin—can lay low an entire party of heroes. The wasps represented here are of the common variety also known as yellowjackets, but many other sorts of dangerous wasps exist, such as a Garundi variant that swarms in such great numbers that it can decimate entire villages, and the dreaded extraplanar hellwasps, which build their nests within the corpses of their victims.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Paralytic Poison</h3>The poison of the giant wasp loses its potency soon after being harvested, but alchemists have learned of a way to preserve some of its properties by adding a number of harsh additives; this method makes it even deadlier.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Sacred Stingers</h3>Wasps are upheld as sacred among the priesthood of the elven deity Calistria, goddess of vengeance. Some priests of Calistria summon giant wasps or wasp swarms as servitors, while a few nurture giant wasps as pets, temple guardians, or companions. Followers of Calistria, both clergy and laypeople alike, seek to emulate the wasp’s penchant for leaving stung victims alive to suffer over a long period: a fitting model for revenge.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
